title: Pre-implementation gate: validate mobile live view UX
description:
Before writing any code, validate that Browserbase's mobile live view is actually usable for hand-offs. Create a free Browserbase account, store credentials in Keychain, launch a test session programmatically, get the live view URL, and have Dave test it on his phone via Telegram. This is a go/no-go gate — if mobile interaction is painful (tiny targets, broken scrolling, lag), we need to revisit the approach before building anything.

Steps:
1. Create Browserbase account (free tier)
2. Store API key as `credential-browserbase-api-key` and project ID as `credential-browserbase-project-id` in Keychain
3. Write a minimal test script that creates a session, navigates to a test site, and retrieves the debuggerFullscreenUrl
4. Send Dave the live view URL via Telegram with instructions to test: tap links, scroll, type in a form field, interact with buttons
5. Get Dave's verdict on mobile UX
6. If pass: upgrade to Developer plan ($20/month), proceed to s-b02. If fail: stop and reassess approach.

Measurable pass/fail criteria:
- Dave can complete a form interaction (tap input field, type text, tap submit button) on his phone in under 60 seconds
- Text is legible without zooming
- Buttons/links are tappable without precision frustration
- Page scrolls smoothly
- Latency is under 3 seconds for interactions
notes: 2026-02-07: Account created by Dave (Turnstile CAPTCHA blocked automation). Org: bmo-hurley, email: bmo_hurley@fastmail.com. API key and project ID stored in Keychain. Test session created via SDK, navigated to Wikipedia Adventure Time page, live view URL sent to Dave via Telegram. Dave confirmed: desktop page, can zoom and scroll. GO verdict — usable for hand-off scenarios. Skipping Developer plan upgrade for now (free tier sufficient for PoC build).
acceptanceCriteria: Browserbase free account created and credentials stored in Keychain
Test script successfully creates a session and retrieves live view URL
Dave completes a form interaction on his phone in under 60 seconds (tap field, type, tap button)
Text is legible without zooming, buttons are tappable, scrolling works, latency under 3s
Go/no-go decision recorded. If GO: upgrade to Developer plan before proceeding.
